title: 'No deportation': MHA clears 'misconceptions' about CAA
description: The ministry of home affairs on Tuesday with respect to Citizenship Amendment rules said that “Many misconceptions have been spread regarding the CAA

title: Haryana political developments: BJP consolidates ahead of elections; what next for Dushyant Chautala's JJP?
description: The politics in Haryana took a new turn on Tuesday with BJP ejecting its ally Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) out of the government ahead of elections. Manohar Lal Khattar stepped down as chief minister today ending the over four-year-old coalition government formed with the help of JJP in 2019.

title: Nijjar row: New Zealand says it respects India's territorial integrity but also rule of law
description: Walking the diplomatic tightrope on the India-Canada diplomatic spat over the killing of a Khalistan separatist in Canada, the visiting New Zealand deputy PM and foreign minister, Winston Peters, said Tuesday that the South Pacific country respects the rule of law as much as it does India’s territorial integrity.

title: SBI submits all electoral bonds details to Election Commission
description: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Tuesday submitted all data related to electoral bonds to the Election Commission of India (ECI) in compliance with the strict Supreme Court regarding the matter.

title: PM Modi inaugurates India's first in-plant train transport at Maruti factory: To cut down 50,000 truck trips
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated India's first-ever automobile in-plant railway siding at Maruti Suzuki's Gujarat facility through a virtual conference. This initiative, aligned with the PM's flagship Gati Shakti programme, aims to elevate logistics, curb carbon emissions, and ease out road congestion.

title: Pentagon to give Ukraine $300 million in weapons even as it lacks funds to replenish US stockpile
description: The Pentagon will rush about $300 million in weapons to Ukraine after finding some cost savings in its contracts, even though the military remains deeply overdrawn and needs at least $10 billion to replenish all the weapons it has pulled from its stocks to help Kyiv in its desperate fight against Russia, senior defense officials said Tuesday.

title: PM Modi talks to UK's Rishi Sunak about free trade agreement
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday talked to UK PM Rushi Sunak about strengthening the bilateral Comprehensive Strategic Partnership as well as a free trade agreement between the two countries.

title: New Haryana CM Nayab Saini likely to face floor test tomorrow
description: New Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini is likely to face the floor test on Wednesday.In a statement to reporters, Saini said that he has asked the governor to conduct the floor test tomorrow at Vidhan Sabha. He also said that the letter of support from 48 MLAs has been submitted.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.2 strikes Andaman Sea
description: An earthquake of magnitude 4.2 shook the Andaman Sea region off the coast of India on March 12, at 11:32 pm.According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), the earthquake occurred at a depth of 67 kilometers with its epicenter located at latitude 10.06 and longitude 95.00.

title: 2-week ban imposed on Imran Khan meetings in jail
description: Pakistani authorities imposed on Tuesday a two-week ban on all visits,meetings and interviewers at Rawalpindi's Adiala's jail, where PTI chief and former Prime Minister Imran Khan has been incarcerated , citing security threats

title: Turkey's Erdogan urges global pressure on Israel to allow more aid into Gaza
description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan on Tuesday called for increased international pressure on Israel to ensure more humanitarian aid is allowed into Gaza, and said Ankara will increase its support during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

title: EU set o give Ukraine $5.46 billion military aid amid war with Russia
description: European Union countries are close to a deal on a military aid fund for Ukraine that would pave the way for an injection of 5 billion euros ($5.46 billion), diplomats said on Tuesday.

title: Elon Musk rails against potential TikTok ban after Trump, says it's about 'censorship and government control'
description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has joined former US President Donald Trump to denounce the potential federal ban on Chinese app TikTok, which is widely popular among the youngsters in the United States.

title: Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan to be extradited to UK, Romanian court rules
description: Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan Tate will be extradited to the United Kingdom, a Romanian court ruled on Tuesday, March 12. The duo were previously detained in Romania after an arrest warrant was issued by the British authorities. Andrew and Tristan were detained on Monday evening for 24 hours for sexual aggression allegations dating back to 2012-2015.

title: 'This can't be true, Virat is the biggest draw': England great shocked over Kohli's potential T20 World Cup exclusion
description: After a report emerged that Virat Kohli could be dropped from India's T20 World Cup squad, former England pacer Stuart Broad expressed his surprise on the news saying he believes that the star batter would indeed be chosen for the event.

title: Women's Premier League: All-round Ellyse Perry fires Royal Challengers Bangalore into play-offs
description: Star Australian all-rounder Ellyse Perry produced a record bowling figures of six for 15 and followed it up with a stylish unbeaten 40-run knock as Royal Challengers Bangalore blew away Mumbai Indians by seven wickets to sail through to the playoffs in Women's Premier League on Tuesday

title: How Rishabh Pant bounced back from darkness and despair
description: Rishabh Pant is fit to play competitive cricket again, 14 months after his brush with death in a road accident near Roorkee, Uttarakhand.

title: Hardik Pandya ripped into by Praveen Kumar over MI captaincy in IPL: 'Gets injured, doesn't play domestic or for India'
description: Praveen Kumar blasted Hardik Pandya for giving more preference to playing IPL and earning the big bucks than playing for the country or for his domestic team.

title: Cole Palmer was hugely influential as Chelsea saw off Newcastle in the Premier League at Stamford Bridge.
description: Once again, Palmer was influential for the Blues when they needed him most. He provided the assist for Jackson's goal before producing a superb finish himself, meaning he now has 19 Premier League goal involvements this season - 11 goals and eight assists.

title: Barcelona reached the Champions League quarter-finals for the first time in four years with an entertaining victory over Napoli.
description: Fermin Lopez and Joao Cancelo put Barcelona on their way at Estadi de Montjuic, but the hosts were made to work hard by the Italian side who pulled one back through Amir Rrahmani.

title: How Darwin Nunez & Virgil van Dijk are making the difference to Liverpool's title bid
description: I know from my own experiences as a Liverpool player that, when you are losing at Anfield then equalise straight after half-time, it does more than give you momentum - it can change the whole feel of a game.

title: Real Madrid inch closer to La Liga title with 4-0 win over Celta Vigo
description: La Liga leaders Real Madrid regained their seven-point cushion at the top as they benefitted from two own goals in a comfortable 4-0 home win over struggling Celta Vigo.

title: Al-Hilal: Saudi Pro League side break world record with 28th successive win
description: Tuesday's 2-0 win over Al-Ittihad in the Asian Champions League was the 28th victory in a row for Al-Hilal, Saudi Arabia's most decorated team.

title: Ronaldo's efforts not enough as Al Nassr exit Asian Champions League
description: Cristiano Ronaldo's extra-time goal was not sufficient to secure a victory for Al Nassr as they were eliminated from the Asian Champions League quarter-finals by Al Ain on penalties.
